Step: 1. In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat oil and temper with cumin seeds (jeera) and asafoetida (hing).
2. Add tomato puree and cook until all the moisture reduces.
3. Add all the spices and a bit of sugar, then cook for another 30 seconds.
4. Add the potatoes and 1 glass of water (250ml), letting the mixture cook until it reaches a thick consistency.
5. Mash some of the potatoes in the gravy to get the typical "rase wale aloo" texture.
6. Serve the Rase Wale Aloo with Puri or Pudina Tawa Paratha for lunch or dinner.
